page.title: 01LANDSCAPES AND BUILDINGS 1
page.content: In Rotherwick village there is a small shop, a church, and two pubs as well as a school. The village shop sells fruit and all kinds of other goods. There is also an adjoining craft shop , where hobby ceramics and other crafts like spinning take place. The church is about 700 years old, the oldest part (the chancel) dates back to the 13th. century. There was a tower added in the 17th. century. There are two pubs, The Coach and Horses,and The Falcon. The Falcon has a field of animals behind it, there are goats, sheep, ducks, geese and chickens.The Coach and Horses has a house next door which was once a blacksmiths as the horses used to pull up there and the blacksmith used to do any work required.
